member.name: T:JunX.NETStandard.EncryptionService.EncryptionService
member.summary: Provides symmetric encryption and decryption services using AES, with keys derived from a user-supplied string.
member.remarks: This class generates a SHA256-based encryption key and an MD5-based initialization vector (IV) from the provided input string. It supports secure transformation of plaintext to encrypted Base64 strings and vice versa. Designed for scenarios requiring lightweight, consistent encryption logic across applications.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.EncryptionService.EncryptionService.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified key string to derive encryption parameters.
member.param: A string used to generate the AES encryption key and initialization vector (IV).
member.remarks: The provided key string is hashed using SHA256 to produce the encryption key and MD5 to produce the IV. This ensures consistent and deterministic cryptographic parameters for symmetric encryption and decryption.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.EncryptionService.EncryptionService.Encrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Encrypts the specified plaintext string using AES and returns the result as a Base64-encoded string.
member.param: The plaintext string to encrypt.
member.returns: A Base64-encoded string representing the encrypted form of the input.
member.exception: Thrown when encryption fails due to invalid input or a cryptographic error.
member.remarks: This method uses AES encryption with a key and IV derived from the constructor input. The encrypted output is written to a memory stream and encoded as Base64 for safe transport or storage.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.EncryptionService.EncryptionService.Decrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts the specified Base64-encoded string using AES and returns the original plaintext.
member.param: A Base64-encoded string representing the encrypted data.
member.returns: The decrypted plaintext string.
member.exception: Thrown when the input is not a valid Base64 string or when decryption fails due to invalid cryptographic parameters or corrupted data.
member.remarks: This method uses AES decryption with a key and IV derived from the constructor input. It expects the input to be a valid Base64 string produced by the Encrypt method.

member.name: T:JunX.NETStandard.EncryptionService.InvalidTextParameterException
member.summary: Represents errors that occur when text input is invalid or incompatible with encryption or decryption operations.
member.remarks: This custom exception is used to wrap cryptographic and formatting errors with domain-specific context. It supports default, message-only, and inner-exception constructors for flexible error handling.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.EncryptionService.InvalidTextParameterException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with no message or inner exception.
member.remarks: This constructor is useful when throwing a generic exception without additional context.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.EncryptionService.InvalidTextParameterException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: A descriptive message that explains the reason for the exception.
member.remarks: Use this constructor to provide context-specific error details when throwing the exception.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.EncryptionService.InvalidTextParameterException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that caused this exception.
member.param: A descriptive message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified.
member.remarks: Use this constructor to wrap lower-level exceptions with domain-specific context for encryption and decryption failures.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.EncryptionService.InvalidTextParameterException.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the current instance.
member.returns: A string that describes the exception, including the message and stack trace if available.
member.remarks: This override delegates to the base implementation and is useful for logging or debugging exception details.

member.name: T:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.BuilderExtensions
member.summary: Provides MySQL Execution extentions to the SQLBuilder group of classes. These methods are to be used in conjunction with an instance of DBConnect Class assuming that the instance's internal MySqlConnection is initialized and is open.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.BuilderExtensions.ExecuteAdapter``1(JunX.NETStandard.SQLBuilder.SelectCommand{``0},JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.DBConnect)
member.summary: Executes the composed SQL SELECT statement represented by the instance using the specified context and returns the result via a data adapter.
member.typeparam: The enum type representing the table schema used in the query.
member.param: The instance containing the SQL query to execute.
The instance responsible for executing the query and managing the adapter logic.
member.exception: Thrown when the delegated execution fails or the adapter encounters an error during processing.

member.name: T:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.DBConnect.ConfigGenerator
member.summary: Provides static methods for generating, retrieving, and validating a custom MySQL connection string configuration file.
member.remarks: This class creates and manages a standalone DBConnect.config file located in the application's base directory. The configuration file contains a configuration root element with a nested ConnectionString section, which includes an Add element storing the connection string, provider name, and identifier. All operations are performed statically and assume a single named connection entry.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.DBConnect.ConfigGenerator.GenerateDBConfig(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a new configuration file containing a MySQL connection string entry.
member.param: The connection string to be embedded in the configuration file. Must be non-empty and properly formatted.
member.exception: Thrown when the provided connection string is null, empty, or consists only of whitespace.
member.remarks: This method creates a DBConnect.config file in the application's base directory. The file structure includes a root configuration element with a nested ConnectionString section. Within that section, an Add element is written with attributes for name, connectionString, and providerName. The file is overwritten if it already exists.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.DBConnect.ConfigGenerator.GetConnectionString
member.summary: Retrieves the MySQL connection string from the custom DBConnect.config file.
member.returns: The connection string value associated with the predefined name, or null if not found.
member.exception: Thrown when the configuration file DBConnect.config is missing from the application's base directory.
member.remarks: This method loads the XML configuration file and searches for an Add element under the ConnectionString section. It returns the value of the connectionString attribute if the name attribute matches the predefined constant. The XML structure is expected to be case-sensitive and well-formed.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.DBConnect.ConfigGenerator.ConfigExists
member.summary: Checks whether the DBConnect.config file exists in the application's base directory.
member.returns: true if the configuration file is present; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs a simple file existence check using . It does not validate the file's contents or structure.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.DBConnect.ExecuteReader
member.summary: Executes the current SQL SELECT command and stores the result set values in the internal collection.
member.exception: Thrown when the command execution fails due to connection issues, invalid SQL syntax, or runtime errors.
member.remarks:
This method performs the following steps:
Validates the connection and command text using .
Assigns the current to the internal and clears existing parameters.
Executes the command using ExecuteReader() and stores the result in InternalVariables.Reader.
If rows are returned, iterates through each field of each row and adds the stringified values to InternalVariables.Values.
Intended for use with SQL SELECT queries that return tabular data.

member.remarks:
This method performs the following steps:
Validates the connection and command text using .
Assigns the current to the internal and clears existing parameters.
Binds the provided parameter using AddWithValue and executes the command using ExecuteReader().
If rows are returned, iterates through each field of each row and adds the stringified values to InternalVariables.Values.
Intended for use with parameterized SELECT queries that return tabular data.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.DBConnect.CloseConnection
member.summary: Closes the internal MySQL connection if it is currently open.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.DBConnect.CloseReader
member.summary: Closes the internal if it is currently open.
member.remarks: This method checks the property and closes the reader only if it is still active. Useful for releasing data stream resources after query execution to prevent locking or memory leaks.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.DBConnect.DisposeAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously disposes internal database-related resources and resets associated metadata.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous disposal operation.
member.remarks:
This method performs a thorough cleanup of internal objects used during database operations:
Disposes , , and instances.
Closes and disposes the if it is still open.
Asynchronously disposes the if it is active.
Resets internal metadata fields such as connection string, command text, and value list to null.
Recommended for use in asynchronous workflows to ensure proper resource release and prevent memory or connection leaks.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.DBConnect.ResetConnection

Ensures the internal is open.
Verifies that is not null, empty, or whitespace.
Confirms that the command text contains a valid SQL SELECT keyword.
Intended to safeguard query execution logic by enforcing preconditions.

member.name: T:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.EnumGenerator
member.summary: Provides functionality to generate C# enum files from MySQL table and column metadata.
member.remarks: This class connects to a MySQL database using the provided connection string, retrieves table and column names from the specified , and generates corresponding .cs files containing enum definitions for each table. Each enum includes the table name and its columns as members, with whitespace and hyphens replaced by underscores. Intended for use in code generation scenarios where database schema needs to be reflected in strongly typed constructs.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.EnumGenerator.#ctor(System.String,System.Data.ConnectionState@)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and attempts to open a connection to the specified MySQL server.
member.param: The connection string used to establish a connection to the MySQL server. This should include server, user ID, and passwordbut must not include the database name.
An output parameter that reflects the final state of the connection after the attempt to open it.
member.exception: Thrown when the connection attempt fails due to invalid credentials, unreachable server, or other connection-related issues.
member.remarks: This constructor creates a new using the provided connection string and attempts to open it. If successful, is set to Open; otherwise, it is set to Closed and an exception is thrown. Note: The should not include the database name, as it is set separately via the property.

member.name: P:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.EnumGenerator.DatabaseName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the MySQL database to be used for table and column enumeration.
member.value: A representing the target database name for metadata extraction.
member.remarks: This property must be set before invoking any schema-related methods such as GenerateEnumFiles. The database name should not be included in the ServerConnectionString passed to the constructor.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.MySQL.EnumGenerator.GenerateEnumFiles(System.String)
member.summary: Generates C# enum files for each table in the specified MySQL database and saves them to the target folder.
member.param: The directory path where the generated .cs enum files will be saved. The folder will be created if it does not exist.
member.remarks:
This method performs the following steps:
Retrieves all table names from the database specified in .
For each table, retrieves its column names and generates a corresponding enum definition.
Creates the output folder if necessary and writes each enum to a separate .cs file named after the table.
Each enum includes the table name and its columns as members, with spaces and hyphens replaced by underscores.

member.remarks:
This method constructs a SQL fragment in the form:
WHERE Column BETWEEN Left AND Right

member.summary: Reads RDLC files.

member.name: M:JunX.NETStandard.XML.RDLCReader.RDLC_ToEnumFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a C# enum file from the list of ReportParameter names defined in an RDLC report.
member.param: The full path to the RDLC file to parse.
The destination path where the generated enum file will be saved.
member.remarks:
This method loads the RDLC file as XML, extracts all unique ReportParameter names, sanitizes them into valid C# identifiers, and writes them as members of a public enum. The enum name is derived from the exported C# file name (excluding extension).
Example: If is InvoiceReport.rdlc, the output will be:
public enum InvoiceReport { StartDate, EndDate, IncludeLogo }
Each enum member is comma-separated except the last, ensuring valid syntax.
member.exception: Thrown when the RDLC file does not exist at the specified .
